function: Presents peptides derived from intracellular proteins to cytotoxic T cells.
Modulates the activity of natural killer cells.
Plays a role in immune response and presenting antigenic peptides.
Important for immune tolerance during pregnancy.
Presents peptides to the immune system and modulates immune responses.
Involved in immune regulation and antigen presentation.
Contributes to immune system function by presenting peptides to T cells.
Participates in the presentation of antigens to the immune system.

description: DR β1-chain determining specificities DR1, DR2, DR3, DR4, DR5 etc.
function: Plays a central role in presenting peptides to helper T cells.
